alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 4:22PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to nearly stationary thunderstorms. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen during the couple of hours from these storms .Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area from these slow moving storms. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a flash flood warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Homestead, The Redland, Homestead General Airport, Kendall, Florida City, Richmond West, Country Walk, Naranja, Goulds, Princeton, Zoo Miami, Leisure City, The Hammocks, West Perrine, Richmond Heights, The Crossings, Homestead Base, Intersection Krome And Kendall Drive, West Kendall and Cutler Bay. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
